A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Made me think of the following movies:

Mary Poppins\, Oceans 11\, Oliver twist\, fantastic beasts\, pokemon\, harry potter\, gremlins (when arsonist yoda turned up) and many many classics but with my head in my hands.

Now for the actual review. Everything Force Awakens built is gone and there is nothing of any substance to look forward to.

The moment the movie starts the tone of it is set\, overly pantomime theatrical like\, and that tone is forever with you through the movie. Snoke is basically nothing nothing seriously nothing.  Those at the top of the Order are hormonal teenage like characters.  Full of name drops with little reason. The back story to Kylo don't expect much. Back story to Luke going into exile don't expect much.  Actually don't expect anything from Luke at all. He has butlers and a farm on that island. Expect a whiney Ren who continuously Skype calls Kylo in an attempt to establish a long distance relationship for no reason.

Slowest galactic chase ever. More weak point hits to blow up entire ships. A ship that looked like a milkshake containing explosives with a massive gaping hole and a load drop mechanism guaranteed to give the enemy about a minute to shoot one of the bombs to take out the entire carrier. Also\, what's the point of ships with gaping entry points? Do people not use their eyes anymore.

As one reviewer has put was this a parody? A joke? A laugh?

I can't even gather all the thoughts to put into words for this review so this is the end of it. 0 development in anything.

This is far from fresh at all and does not honor the Star Wars legacy in the slightest.  This has put me off even thinking of watching any future sequels at all. Will barely bring myself to get the dvds.
